intro: Anemone verae, commonly known as the common anemone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of lobed, hairy leaves. The plant produces showy, white to pinkish flowers with a central cluster of stamens, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade, often found in woodland areas. Anemone verae is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
